title: Antadze 2014 Kvevri Wine Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: Deep ruby in the glass, this wine has a nose of fruits of the wood and smoke. It offers a sophisticated medley of fruit and savory flavors, in particular blackberry, raspberry, tobacco and leather. Firm tannins coat the mouth but do not overpower the palate, allowing for a surprisingly bright finish.

title: Artesa 2013 Morisoli-Borges Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Moderate dusty tannins wrap around a more pronounced density of chocolate, coconut and dried sage in this robust vineyard-designate that persists with a grip on the palate. Accents of cherry and currant give an additional bite of tartness.

title: Balletto 2013 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is showy in fruity ripeness along the midpalate, all creamy, textured flavors of green apple and lemon, before winding down in the glass to allow its high natural acidity to speak. That acidity makes way for a crisp, clear finish and touch of sea spray.

title: Basel Cellars 2013 Estate Double River Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of smoke, green olive, flowers, roasted meat, toast and huckleberry are followed by ripe full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. A lightly creamy feel heightens the interest.

title: Vellichor 2015 Mvua Viognier (Chalk Hill)
description: This robust white wine, 100% varietal, spent time only in stainless steel, allowing the pretty honeysuckle aromas to lift effortlessly to the nose. White fig, peach and a lick of salty stone are supported by crisp, bright acidity.

title: Market Vineyards 2012 Arbitrage Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Baking spice, vanilla, herb, anise and dark cherry aromas are followed by plump cherry and cocoa flavors. The acidity gives the flavors some snap.

title: Martin Ranch 2013 Thérèse Vineyards Dos Niñas Vineyard Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Cracked pepper, dried blueberries, dried violets and strong bay-leaf aromas show prominently on the nose of this bottling from the southern stretches of the Bay Area. There is solid depth to the flavors, with dill, fennel and a savory, peppery teriyaki element spicing up the blackberry and olallieberry fruit.

title: Masi 2008 Serego Alighieri Vaio Armaron  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: You'll find aromas suggesting leather, mature dark-skinned fruit, moist earth and a whiff of game on this brawny red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, raisin, licorice and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

title: Carlos Serres 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Plum, berry and raisin aromas are fine but they don't go beyond the basics for Gran Reserva. This feels solid and dense, but again fairly regular for a mature Gran Reserva. Dry peppery flavors of cherry and cassis seem ready. Drink through 2019.

title: Cesari 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of scorched earth, underbrush, chopped herb and dark spice lead the way on this full-boded wine. The firm, hearty palate offers dried dark cherry, raisin, clove, anise and tobacco framed in solid, fine-grained tannins.

title: Chasing Venus 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This affordably priced wine has a full, generous mouthfeel and harmoniously blends stone fruit, citrus and grassiness. The finish is smooth and silky in texture. Drink now.

title: Château de Lavernette 2014 Cuvée Jean-Jacques de Boissieu  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This is a ripe mango and pineapple flavored wine. It is rich, generous and with a fine balance between acidity and the bold fruitiness. It is young and fruity, ready to drink although it will be even better from 2018.

title: Clos de Gat 2012 Har'el Syrah (Judean Hills)
description: This deep-garnet-colored wine offers a nose of cherry and apple peel. Well-integrated flavors of cherry, cranberry, white chocolate and leather sit within a firm network of tannins, and an unforeseen splash of citrus makes an appearance on the smooth finish.

title: Columbia Crest 2013 Beverly Vineyard Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (49%), Merlot (29%), Cabernet Franc (11%) and Malbec. Aromas of red apple, coffee, herb and plum lead to soft plush blue-fruit flavors. Coffee notes persist on the finish.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 Grand Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of milk chocolate, cherry and spice bring immediate appeal. The flavors are silky and polished, showing equal parts fruit and barrel.

title: Cono Sur 2015 20 Barrels Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Peachy aromas come with mellow notes of oak and woodspice. This feels citrusy, minerally and elegant. Flavors of lemon chiffon and orange are elevated by light oak notes and related vanilla, while this ends with chiseled refinement.

title: David Sterza 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of chopped herb, exotic spice, coconut, menthol and a whiff of new leather lead the nose on this full-bodied structured red. The robust palate offers raisin, blackberry extract, coffee and tobacco alongside firm, fine-grained tannins.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Old vines grown on a three-acre parcel on the lower slopes of Savigny have produced a finely perfumed wine. It has ripe raspberry fruit and a light layer of tannins. The aftertaste is more structured, showing hints of wood aging as well as acidity. Drink the wine from 2018.

title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2015 Vieille Vigne d'Idylle Jacquère (Savoie)
description: This wine is full of apple and green-plum fruits, with a pure, crisp line of acidity. It has concentration and intense fruitiness, a cool wine with a rich character. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Vaugondy 2015 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This ripe, complex wine offers a delicate combination of apple, lemon and honey, with a mineral texture. Balanced already although likely to age well, it is full of fruit, with a more steely texture at the end. Drink now for the fruit, but it will be better to wait until 2018.

title: Domaine des Béguineries 2014 Réserve de Satis  (Chinon)
description: This is a structured wine, still with its tannins intact. It has a firm, dry character, the dark cherry fruit still developing. It is a dense wine with a future. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine des Cognettes 2015 Sélection des Cognettes Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This wine is ripe and full of attractive fruit. With a light touch of pepper as well as rich apples, it is shot through with acidity. Full in the mouth, it finishes with taut minerality.

title: Sergio 2013 Dr. Reid Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This vineyard is within the relatively cool Coombsville appellation. It leaves a memorable impression in its happy mix of violets, white pepper and blueberry, completely robust in integrated tannin. Boldly built, it's balanced, with a softness to the finish.

title: Westwood 2015 Annadel Gap Vineyard White (Sonoma Valley)
description: Estate-grown Roussanne (63%), Viognier (32%) and Chardonnay (5%) are blended together in a medium-bodied coming-together of floral, light aromatics and supportive acidity. Fruity highlights run the gamut of apricot, peach and lime, with a tiny touch of sweetness on the finish.

title: Ryan Patrick 2013 Red Heaven Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas offer notes of dark coffee, baking spice, vanilla, and barrel spices. The palate pulls no punches with full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors along with lightly grainy tannins. The wood plays prominently but it works.

title: Yves Leccia 2014  Muscat de Cap Corse
description: This sweet wine has just a touch of spirit to fill out the perfumed, honeyed fruit. It is generously fruity and deliciously rich. Drink with fruit desserts or as an apéritif.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2010 Montus Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)
description: This is not a true fortified wine but one made from late-harvest Tannat with some added alcohol before fermentation. It produces a delicious wine with superripe blackberry flavors and some tannins. Sweet and rich, it is ready to drink now.

title: Villa Maria 2013 Taylor's Pass Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is VM's big single-vineyard Pinot, but it's already very approachable. Savory overtones of damp earth, outline modest pie-cherry notes that seem somewhat delicate. Enjoy this medium-bodied wine over the next few years for its silky texture.

title: Testarossa 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Pomegranate and cranberry aromas gain complexity from wet slate and wild-thyme touches. The palate blends tangy fruit with earthy herbs, showing sage, dill, Earl Gray tea and fennel against a dried berry backdrop.

title: Secret Squirrel 2012 Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Syrah (48%) makes up nearly half this wine with the rest spread between Grenache (32%) and Mourvèdre. Ripe aromas of red and blue fruit, cranberry and black pepper are followed by a velvety palate that delivers the goods.
